page.title: 13THE ARTS IN WHALTON
page.content: The arts are well represented in this rural area and the parish magazine, representing five local churches, has a cover designed by local artists. One of them is also a musician, Joy Scott, who has written several ballads about her life as a farmer's wife at Riplington. A retired painter, George Thompson, is a master of local dialect and his neighbour was the author/naturalist, Henry Tegner, who published more than twenty_five books and, of course, wrote much about this particular district. His daughter, Veronica Heath, carries on the tradition, has several books published and is Country Diarist for Northumberland county in The Guardian.
